result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Fercho was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 89 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Walworth County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA sample taken at time of arrest.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended and as Agent deems appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the co-actor listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant to contact probation by 09:00 a.m. on 02-09-2016.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph J Fercho in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
89 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  15 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Walworth County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as agent deems appropriate.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actor listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact Probation by 9 am tomorrow (02/09/16).

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250  (Sample taken at time of arrest).
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Jury status hearing at 02-08-2016 03:30 pm
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-09-2016 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 01-29-2016 09:30 am
requesting an adjournment for the court date of November 17, 2015 filed by State.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Joseph J Fercho in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Ian Dekarske from the City of Waukesha, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Benedict. State requests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over. Closing statements presented by Atty. Benedict.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
